qas.question: Before 1641 the privileged ennoblement was granted by what?
What right was reversed by sijm?
What would be given to the enobled one?
After 1641 who was given the privilege of ennoblement?
What clan was given the privileged of enoblement?

context: In the Kingdom of Poland and later in the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, <a1_0>ennoblement<a1_0/> (nobilitacja) may be equated with an individual given legal status as a szlachta (member of the Polish nobility). Initially, this privilege could be granted <a0_0>by monarch<a0_0/>, but from the 1641 onward, this right was reserved for the <a3_0>sejm<a3_0/>. Most often the individual being ennobled would join an existing noble <a4_0>szlachta clan<a4_0/> and assume the <a2_0>undifferentiated coat of arms<a2_0/> of that clan.
